metadata.title: CVE-2016-7498 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenStack Compute (nova) 13.0.0 does not properly delete instances fromcompute nodes, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial ofservice (disk consumption) by deleting instances while in the resize state.NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of a CVE-2015-3280 regression.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-api - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-metadata - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-compute - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-volume - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-cells - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-cert - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-common - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-kvm - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-libvirt - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-lxc - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-qemu - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-vmware - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-xen - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-conductor - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-console - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-consoleauth - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-network - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-novncproxy - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-scheduler - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-serialproxy - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-spiceproxy - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-volume - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-xvpvncproxy - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
python-nova - 2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:13.1.1-0ubuntu1').
